title: ECE seniors I need a few suggestions.
content: which programming language/ frame work is the most important from ece point of view. something that should be given immediate attention and is worth developing all throughout course.

comments.body:
There is one *language / framework* that is important. 

So, throughout my journey in ECE, what I have seen is -   
1. If you are entering core ECE jobs, most preferred is Verilog or any other HDL like system Verilog (taught in PESU). Maybe if you are entering some communication related job, MATLAB and Python are essential tools. There are some specific software tools like CST Studio, EDA Tools, and more as you explore.   
  
2. If you are aiming for CSE job, there are a multitude of them, so cannot them all.

Regardless, I suggest you start doing your **Minors in Computer science** from 3rd sem onwards,

3rd sem - DSA  
4th sem - DAA  
Summer after 4th sem - OS and DBMS

Trust me, it will be really useful for placements.

All the best
for minors in computer science should I take any specific electives or how is it really done

**Minors in CSE** is an altogether different degree, along with your major ECE degree.  
  
They will send a notification on PESU academy regarding all details.   
  
FYI, Electives are two subjects you are allowed to choose in your 5th and 6th semesters
